data.title: NanoMind A3200
data.text:
Versatile Onboard Computer for Cube, Nano and Microsat missions

The NanoMind A3200 can be fitted on top of most GomSpace NanoDock platforms. The NanoDock itself is the size of a standard PC104 board (9.0 cm x 9.6 cm).

Highly miniaturised form-factor for integration in many classes of space missions

Modular design and networked architecture allows for redundancy and distribution of functions

Common interfaces with check-out console (GOSH) and Cubesat Space Protocol (CSP) networking

Main Features

Hardware features:

High-performance AVR32 MCU with advanced power saving features

512 KB build-in flash

128 MB NOR flash (On two dies of 64 MB each)

32 kB FRAM for persistent configuration storage

32 MB SDRAM

RTC clock

On-board temperature sensors

Interfaces:

I2C, UART, CAN-Bus

8 external ADC channels that can also be used as GPIO

External SPI with 3 chip selects

Cubesat Space Protocol (CSP)

GOSH interface for check-out

Attitude control system features:

3-Axis magneto resistive sensor

3-Axis gyroscope

3 bidirectional PWM outputs with current measurements

I2C interface for GomSpace Sensor Bus (GSSB)

Electrical features:

2 x 20-position hard-gold plated FSI one-piece connector
